Pre-Game Insights: Defensive Struggles on Both Sides: Both Benin and Libya have shown defensive fragility in their recent outings.
Steve Mounie’s Influence: Benin’s attack largely revolves around Steve Mounie, who averages two shots on target per game.
Libya’s Scoring Consistency: Libya have been able to score in most of their recent matches, netting in six of their last seven games.
Best Bet: Both Teams to Score @ 6/5
Needing Points: Both teams are desperate for points in this qualifier, and this urgency should make for an open, attacking game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match takes place at the Stade Felix Houphouet-Boigny on Tuesday, September 10, 2024, at 8pm UK.
Benin comes into the match off the back of a 3-0 defeat to Nigeria, while Libya drew 1-1 with Rwanda in their opening game.
